item.title: The Surprising Low Cost Phone Option
item.description:
You might assume that with the popularity of bundled services and internet-based phone options, old-fashioned landlines are obsolete. However, combining this older technology with a competitively priced long-distance service might be the most cost-effective choice. To determine the most affordable option, you need to analyze your needs. Start with the most basic local service, which usually means just having a dial tone. You might find better deals from smaller companies than traditional phone companies...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/the-surprising-low-cost-phone-option/

item.title: Can SIP Trunking Supplant ISDN PRI?
item.description:
Businesses that require multiple phone lines can benefit from digital trunks. While previously only large companies with numerous lines saw advantages with digital trunks, advancements in technology now make them a viable option for businesses with just a few lines and internet access. What exactly constitutes a telephone trunk? Essentially, it is a collection of phone lines bundled together. Unlike individual analog lines, which consist of a twisted pair of copper wires, a trunk combines multiple lines...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/can-sip-trunking-supplant-isdn-pri/

item.title: E911 For Enterprise VoIP
item.description:
The transition from traditional phone lines to internet-based calling has brought about some unexpected issues, particularly with emergency services. We often take 911 for granted, assuming help will always be on the way. However, this isn’t always the case with internet-based phone systems. Imagine a scenario where a fire breaks out in your office. You dial 911, report the emergency, and evacuate. However, the fire department ends up at your company’s headquarters instead of your current location...
Read The Full Article :https://Nexus-Security.github.io/e911-for-enterprise-voip/
